If desired, add accompaniments, such as lettuce, jalapenos, plain yogurt, avocado, and lime juice on top of each.

title: Herby Scallops With Easy Green Beans and Corn
ingredients: 蝧� pound medium scallops (about 10 scallops total) 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided 蝧� pound green beans (about 20 total green beans, trimmed) 2 medium ears corn, shucked and cut off the cob 2 large garlic cloves, minced 蝧� cup fresh parsley, chopped salt and pepper to taste
recipe:
Remove the small side muscle from the scallops. Pat dry.
Melt a tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet (non-stick or cast-iron both work) over medium high heat. Add scallops to the skillet in a single layer and cook, flipping once, until golden brown and translucent in the center, about 2 minutes per side. Season with salt and pepper. Place on a plate and set aside while you prepare the vegetables.
Heat another tablespoon olive oil in the skillet over medium high heat. Add the green beans and a splash of water, cover the skillet and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Take off the cover and add the corn and garlic and saut��� another 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle the herbs over the scallops and parsley and serve.

title: Anti-Inflammatory Quinoa Asparagus Frittata Recipe
ingredients: 2 teaspoons olive oil 1 cup sliced mushrooms 1 cup asparagus, cut into 1-inch pieces 1/2 cup chopped tomato 6 large eggs 2 large egg whites 1/4 cup whole milk or unsweetened non-dairy milk 1/2 teaspoon salt, divided 1/8 teaspoon black pepper 1 cup cooked quinoa 1/2 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese 3 tablespoons chopped basil, divided 1 tablespoon chopped parsley, for garnish
recipe:
Preheat an oven to 350F.
In a medium skillet, approximately 9 to 10 inches, over medium high eat, heat olive oil for 1 minute.
Add mushrooms, asparagus, and half the salt and saut��� until mushrooms are browned and have released their moisture, about 7 minutes.
Add tomatoes to the skillet and cook another 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
Whisk together whole eggs, egg whites, milk, the rest of the salt, and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add eggs, quinoa, cheese, and basil to the skillet with vegetables, stirring gently so that the vegetables are evenly distributed.
Bake on middle rack for 20 minutes, or until eggs are just set inside. Check for doneness at 15 minutes in order to prevent over cooking. Eggs will continue to cook when they?嚙緝e in the skillet.

title: Gluten-Free Slow Cooker BBQ Chicken Recipe
ingredients: 1/4 cup cornstarch 1/2 tsp kosher salt 1 large package boneless skinless chicken thighs (about 1.5 pounds) 2 tsp olive oil 1/2 cup barbecue sauce 1/4 cup 100% apple juice 1/2 red onion, sliced 1 green or red bell pepper, sliced
recipe:
Place the cornstarch and salt in a large resealable bag.
Add the chicken thighs, seal the bag, and shake to coat with cornstarch.
Heat the oil in a skillet or slow cooker with a browning function. Shake excess cornstarch from the chicken and brown on both sides, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. (Depending on the size of your skillet, you may want to brown chicken in two batches.)
In the slow cooker, combine the browned chicken, BBQ sauce, apple juice, onion, and bell pepper; stir to combine. Cover and cook on LOW for 8 hours or HIGH for 4 hours. Shred meat with a fork before serving.

title: Healthy Slow Cooker Moroccan Beef Stew Recipe
ingredients: 3 pounds beef chuck roast 4 teaspoons garlic-infused olive oil, divided 1 cup water, divided 2 medium carrots, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch chunks 1 medium parsnip, peeled, cut into 1/2-inch chunks 1 cup leek leaves, finely chopped 1 teaspoon cumin, ground 1 teaspoon turmeric, ground 1 teaspoon cinnamon, ground 1 teaspoon ginger, ground 1 teaspoon salt 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, freshly ground 2 tablespoons brown sugar, packed light 14.5-ounce can diced tomatoes, undrained 1 pound sweet potato, cubed, skin on, cut into 1-inch pieces
recipe:
Trim and discard visible fat from the beef, and cut it into 1-inch cubes.
In a large skillet, heat half of the oil over medium-high heat.
Add half of the beef, without crowding pieces, and allow them to brown on one side without moving. When pieces are dark brown, after about three minutes, turn them over. Brown the beef on another side for 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove the pieces from the skillet and set aside.
Add half the water to the skillet and scrape up the browned bits. Add this liquid to the slow cooker.
Reheat the skillet with the remaining oil and brown the second batch of beef. Repeat adding the rest of the water to the skillet, scraping browned bits, and adding liquid to the slow cooker.
Add the carrots, parsnip, leek leaves, cumin, turmeric, cinnamon, ginger, salt, pepper, brown sugar, and tomatoes to the slow cooker. Distribute the partially cooked beef in a single layer on top of the vegetables.
Top with sweet potatoes, cover and cook on high for 6?? hours, depending on your slow cooker. The stew is ready to serve when the sweet potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Serve over cooked quinoa or rice.

title: Provencal Chicken Stew
ingredients: 蝧� pound Swiss chard 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons garlic-infused olive oil, divided 6 boneless, skinless chicken thighs, about 1 ��� pounds 蝧� teaspoon salt 蝧� teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 蝧� large red bell pepper, diced 1 large carrot, peeled and diced 蝧� cup chopped celeriac ��� cup finely chopped leek leaves 1 14.5-ounce can diced tomatoes              1 tablespoon Herbes de Provence ��� pound red potatoes with skin, cut into 1/2 inch pieces 1 cup water 15 kalamata olives, pitted and sliced
recipe:
Cut the stems off the Swiss chard and cut them crosswise into 蝧�- inch thick pieces; set aside, keeping stems separate from leaves. Slice the leaves crosswise into 蝧�- inch ribbons, then chop them into thirds in the other direction.
In a large, heavy saucepan or Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon of oil on medium high heat. Sprinkle the whole chicken thighs with salt and pepper, and brown them on both sides until golden brown.
Remove the chicken pieces to a bowl and set aside. Add 2 teaspoons of oil to the pot and add red pepper, carrot, celeriac, leek leaves, and chard stems to the pot and saut��� until softened, 4 to 5 minutes.
Return the chicken to the pot and add tomatoes with juices, Herbes de Provence, potatoes, and 1 cup water. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in the chard leaves and olives, cover and cook until the leaves are soft and potatoes are cooked through, about 5 minutes. Ladle into bowls and serve hot.

title: Classic Shakshuka Recipe With Homemade Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 1 tbsp garlic-infused olive oil 3/4 cup fennel bulb, very finely chopped (3 ounces) 1/2 large red bell pepper, very finely chopped 1/2 cup scallion greens, thinly sliced, divided 1/4 tsp ground cumin 1/4 tsp smoked paprika 1/4 tsp salt 1/4 tsp black pepper, freshly ground 1/3 cup water 1 14.5-ounce can diced unsalted tomatoes, undrained 1 tbsp tomato paste 4 large eggs 2 tbsp crumbled feta cheese
recipe:
In an 8-inch skillet over medium heat, warm the garlic-infused oil. Add the fennel, red pepper, and most of the scallions, reserving some scallions for a garnish.
Add cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, and water; saute briefly, then cover and adjust heat to simmer until the vegetables are tender about 20 minutes. If the liquid evaporates before the vegetables have cooked and softened to your liking, you may add water 1 tablespoon at a time to prolong this stage.
Add the tomatoes and tomato paste and simmer for another 15 minutes, until the sauce resembles a chunky, jarred spaghetti sauce.
Using the back of a large spoon, create divots in the surface of the tomato sauce, one for each egg. Crack the eggs one at a time into a small bowl, check for shell pieces, and tip egg gently into the divots to avoid breaking the yolks. Cover the pan and cook, checking frequently, to your preferred level of doneness, up to 10 minutes.
Top with crumbled feta cheese and the remaining scallions and serve.

title: One-Pot North African Spicy Shakshuka
ingredients: 2 teaspoons olive oil 蝧� yellow onion, sliced 2 teaspoons chili paste (Sambal Oelek recommended) 1 orange bell pepper, sliced 1 clove garlic, thinly sliced 1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt 4 large eggs 蝧� cup feta cheese, crumbled 蝧� cup fresh parsley, chopped
recipe:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Heat oil in a large oven-safe skillet.
Add onion, chili paste, and pepper, then cook for 10 minutes to soften.
Add garlic, tomatoes and salt and stir well.
Add 1 cup water and allow to simmer over medium heat for an additional 15 minutes.
Using a large spoon, press a well into the tomato mixture and place each egg in gently.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and cook for 7 to 10 minutes, or until eggs are cooked as desired.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with crumbled feta.
Garnish with parsley and allow to cool slightly before serving.

title: Tuna Salad Collard Green Wrap
ingredients: 1 large collard green leaf 1 (5-ounce) canned tuna, drained 1 tablespoon nonfat Greek yogurt 1 teaspoon mayonnaise 蝧� cup diced apple (unpeeled), or celery Juice and zest of 1/2 a lime 1 medium carrot, shredded
recipe:
Remove the hard, lower portion of the collard green stem and place the in a large pot of boiling water for 15 seconds.
Remove collard leaf, pat dry, and set aside.
In a bowl, combine canned tuna, yogurt, mayonnaise, apple, and lime juice and zest; mix to combine.
Lay collard green out on a flat surface and place some shredded carrots in the center, followed by the tuna mixture.
Like a burrito, fold in both the left and right side of the collard over the filling.
Starting at the end closest to you, roll up.
Cut in half and serve.

title: Gluten-Free Spaghetti and Meatballs With Homemade Sauce
ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil 1 clove garlic, chopped 蝧� medium onion, chopped 1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper 3 tablespoons chopped basil 8 gluten-free crackers 1 pound 90% lean ground beef 1 large egg, beaten 1 teaspoon kosher salt 蝧� teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 1 clove garlic, mined 2 tablespoons chopped basil
recipe:
To prepare the sauce, heat olive oil in a medium saucepan.
Add garlic and onion and saut��� for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes, then season with oregano, salt, and black pepper to taste. Cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in basil and set aside.
While the sauce is simmering, prepare the meatballs. Preheat oven to 400F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil and set aside.
Place crackers in a food processor and grind into fine crumbs.
In a large bowl, combine gluten free breadcrumbs, ground beef, egg, salt, pepper, garlic and basil.
With clean hands, gently mix well and form into approximately sixteen 1-ounce balls. Transfer to baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 160F.
Once meatballs are cooked, add them to the sauce.

title: Salmon Patties With Mango Salsa
ingredients: 1/4 cup dry quinoa 1 6-ounce can salmon 1/3 cup chopped parsley leaves 1 tablespoon lemon juice 1/4 cup plain breadcrumbs 1 large egg 1/2 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper 1/2 tablespoon cumin 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 small mango, diced 1/2 bell pepper, chopped 1/4 red onion, chopped 2 tablespoons lemon juice 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt
recipe:
Prepare quinoa according to package instructions.
Combine all ingredients for the patties (quinoa through cumin) in a small bowl. Shape the mixture into six small patties.
Heat olive oil in a large shallow pan over low to medium heat. Coat the entire pan with the oil. Fry the patties, about 5 minutes per side. If the patty starts to fall apart when you're trying to flip it, keep it on its side for a few minutes longer.
Combine the remainder of the ingredients in a small bowl and serve with the salmon patties.

title: Sweet Potato Hash With Tomatoes and Kale
ingredients: 1 medium sweet potato 2 teaspoons olive oil 蝧� teaspoon kosher salt freshly ground black pepper 1 cup chopped kale 1 cup chopped tomatoes 4 large eggs
recipe:
Shred sweet potato using a box grater or julienne peeler.
Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add sweet potato, season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Saut��� sweet potatoes for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add kale and tomato and continue to saut��� for an additional 5 minutes.
Once kale is slightly wilted and sweet potato is crispy, transfer to a plate.
Return skillet to the heat and add eggs to the pan; cook as desired.
Serve eggs over sweet potato mixture.

title: Gluten-Free Roasted Za?嚙窮tar Chicken Thighs
ingredients: 4 small boneless, skinless chicken thighs 1 tablespoon olive oil Juice from 蝧� large lemon 1 teaspoon za?嚙窮tar 蝧� teaspoon sesame seeds 蝧� teaspoon sea salt
recipe:
Preheat oven to 425F.
In a large mixing bowl, add chicken thighs.
Pour in the olive oil, lemon juice, za?嚙窮tar, sesame seeds, and sea salt over the chicken.
Mix thoroughly so all of the chicken pieces are evenly coated with seasoning.
Place chicken thighs on a foil-lined baking sheet and roast for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown on top.

title: Cod Parchment Packs: An Easy Weeknight Dinner
ingredients: 2 cups sweet potato, julienned 1 pound cod, divided into 4 pieces 1 teaspoon dried thyme leaves 4 teaspoons olive oil 1 teaspoon kosher salt 4 slices of fresh lemon
recipe:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Fold 4 sheets of parchment paper in half.
Place 蝧� of the sweet potatoes on one side of the parchment and top with a piece of cod.
Sprinkle each piece of fish with 蝧� teaspoon thyme, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 蝧� teaspoon, salt and a slice of lemon.
Fold the parchment paper over the fish and vegetables, then fold and crease the edges to form a closed and crescent shaped packet.
Transfer packets to a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and allow to rest for 5 minutes before tearing open.

title: Heartburn-Friendly Pancakes With Red Delicious Apples
ingredients: 1/2 cup whole-wheat flour 1/2 cup all-purpose flour 1 tablespoon sugar 1 teaspoon baking powder 1/4 teaspoon salt 1 cup fat-free milk 1 large egg, beaten 2 tablespoons avocado, mashed 1 tablespoon water non-stick cooking spray 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted 1 large red delicious apple 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon 2 tablespoons water 1.5 teaspoons honey, divided
recipe:
Combine the dry ingredients (whole-wheat flour, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt) in a small bowl.
Whisk together the wet ingredients (milk, egg, avocado, and water) in a separate bowl, then add to the dry ingredients and stir until well incorporated.
Spray a large pan with non-stick cooking spray and heat over a low-medium flame. Spoon the pancake batter into the pan, about 2 tablespoons per pancake, and flatten down into a round shape. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes on one side and an additional minute on the other, until slightly golden brown.
While the pancakes are cooking, core and thinly slice the apple into 12 slices. In a bowl, pour the butter over the slices and mix with the ginger and cinnamon.
Arrange the apple slices in a separate pan and cook over medium flame for 3-5 minutes, until slightly softened. Add the water halfway through.
Arrange 4 pancakes on a plate and top with the cooked apples. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon honey and enjoy.

title: Chicken Soup Noodle Bowl: Satisfy Your Soup Craving
ingredients: 2 cups low-sodium chicken broth 1 ounce dry rice noodles 蝧� cup sugar snap peas 2 ounces shredded chicken
recipe:
Heat chicken broth in a small saucepan until simmering.
Add rice noodles and cook, stirring occasional until noodles are tender.
Add snap peas and cooked chicken and simmer for an additional 2 to 3 minutes until snap peas are slightly tender and all ingredients are warmed through.
Serve immediately.

title: Red Beet and Goat Cheese Ravioli Recipe
ingredients: 2 medium beets, plus the stems and greens 4 ounces goat cheese 2 tablespoons almond flour 40 small wonton wrappers (from a 12-ounce package) 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 medium clove garlic, pressed 2 tablespoons finely grated Parmesan cheese
recipe:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Separate the beets from their stems and set the steams aside. Cut the tips off the beets and wrap individually in foil and place on baking sheet. Roast until tender when pierced with the knife, about 1 hour. Open foil carefully (steam will escape). Turn off the oven and let the beets cool.
Once cool enough to handle, peel the beets. Using the fine holes of a box grater, finely grate the beets into a medium bowl.
Add goat cheese and season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the almond flour.
To make the ravioli: Set out a small bowl of water. Place 1 teaspoon of beet filling into the center of a wonton wrapper. Dip a brush or (use your finger) into the water and brush the edges of the wonton wrapper with water and fold the dough over the filling to form a triangle or semi-circle depending on the shape of your wrapper. Push out as much air as possible and press the edges to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers.
To make the sauce and cook the ravioli: Finely chop the beet stems and tear the beet greens into bite-size pieces. Set aside. Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Add a third of the ravioli to the water and boil for 2 minutes, stirring often.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the cooked ravioli to the skillet and saute for another minute.
Place onto a plate and serve with Parmesan cheese.

title: Sweet Pan-Seared Tilapia Over Golden Rice Recipe
ingredients: 1/4 cup uncooked brown rice 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano 1/2 teaspoon dried basil 1/8 teaspoon ground turmeric 1 teaspoon olive oil 4 oz. tilapia fillet 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper 1/2 teaspoon paprika 1 tablespoon dried raisins and cranberries, chopped (about 7 each)
recipe:
After rinsing your rice, place in a small pot and mix in the salt, pepper, oregano, basil, and turmeric. Add about 3/4 cup water, bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and cover the pot. Cook for 45 minutes. If you notice that the water is completely absorbed before the rice is tender, add more and continue cooking. Once tender, remove from heat and let sit for ten minutes, covered.
While the rice is cooking, heat olive oil in a small pan. Sprinkle salt, pepper, and paprika onto the tilapia and add to the pan, cooking for 4-5 minutes on each side (until the fish is flaky when pierced with a fork).
After removing the tilapia, add 2 tablespoons water to the pan and add the dried fruit. Let simmer over low heat for 3-4 minutes, until the water evaporates.
Plate the rice, fish, and dried fruit.

title: Flavorful Dijon-Thyme Roasted Salmon
ingredients: 1 pound fresh salmon, skin removed 2 teaspoons olive oil 蝧� teaspoon kosher salt 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard 蝧� teaspoon dried thyme Lemon wedges, for serving
recipe:
Preheat oven to 400F.
Cut salmon into 4 equal sized pieces.
Place pieces of salmon on a sheet pan lined with parchment paper.
Brush each piece of salmon with olive oil and season with salt.
Place fish in the oven and roast for 10 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix Dijon mustard and dried thyme and set aside.
After 10 minutes of cooking, brush salmon with mustard-thyme mixture.
Return fish to the oven for 5 to 8 minutes more, or until salmon is just cooked through.
Remove from the oven and allow to rest for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Feta Omelette Roulade Recipe
ingredients: 3 large eggs 1 tablespoon unsweetened almond milk 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1/8 teaspoon turmeric 1/8 teaspoon cumin 1/8 teaspoon paprika 1 teaspoon olive oil 1/4 cup fresh arugula leaves 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese 1/2 medium carrot, julienned 1/4 bell pepper, any color, julienned 1/4 small zucchini, julienned
recipe:
In a small bowl, combine eggs, almond milk, salt, pepper, and spices. Beat until well combined.
Heat the olive oil in a 10-inch non-stick pan or skillet over medium heat for a 5 to 10 seconds.
Evenly pour in the egg mixture. Cook covered over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes, or until you can easily flip the omelette using a spatula. Flip halfway and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes on the other side.
When ready, remove from heat and let cool completely, about 10 minutes. You can use this time to cut up your vegetables.
Arrange arugula leaves on the cooled omelette. Sprinkle the feta cheese on top, then arrange the carrots, bell pepper, and zucchini along the middle and sides. Leave about two inches from one end empty for easier rolling.
Roll the omelette, keeping the edge under it once rolled. Cut in half and enjoy!
